case.name: SZIMB v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural Affairs [2006] FCA 1405 (30 October 2006)

citances.sentence: 16 It is well settled that leave to appeal will only be granted where the judgment appealed from is attended with sufficient doubt and substantial injustice would arise if leave to appeal was refused (see, for example, SZIMB v Minister for Immigration & Multicultural Affairs [2006] FCA 1405 at [10] ).

legistitles.title: MIGRATION ACT 1958
MIGRATION ACT 1958 - SECT 426A Failure of applicant to appear before Tribunal
FEDERAL COURT RULES 1979
